page.title: 14Festivals - Ecclesiastical
page.content: Religious festivals are celebrated throughout the year by both Church and Chapel - Christmas, Boxing Day, Shrove Tuesday (eating of pancakes),Ash Wednesday, Lent, Palm Sunday (flowers for graves), Good Friday (hot cross buns for children), Easter Day (joyous services and gifts to children of Easter eggs), Mothering Sunday, Whit Sunday (procession around the village) and Harvest (a service of thanksgiving for produce grown. In Wales on Easter Monday, chapels have a 'Gymynfa Ganu' - a festival of song and praise. The Sunday closest to November 11th. is always Remembrance Sunday on which we remember the dead of the 2 World Wars with a parade to the Cenotaph and the wearing of a poppy. Halloe'en the night before All Soul's Day is celebrated by children dressing up as witches or ghosts.
